items.sentence: Tom saw Mary walking in the park with someone he didn\'t know.
Tom purposely wore his shirt inside out just to irritate Mary.
Tom speaks French only slightly better than he speaks English.
When I told Tom that I was hungry, he said he was hungry, too.
Tom has some very important things he needs to do before 2:30.
It was obvious to everybody that Tom didn\'t want to be there.
I don\'t want you to feel that I\'m pressuring you to do this.
Under normal circumstances, Tom would never agree to go there.
Tom suspected that Mary was the one who had broken the window.
Do you know why Tom and Mary didn\'t go to the dance together?
We have to figure out whether we have enough money to do that.
If it were me, I think I\'d try going to a different hospital.
If you should have any trouble, don\'t hesitate to come to me.
Mary is wearing the same dress that she was wearing yesterday.
Tom is my friend now, but we didn\'t like each other at first.
Tom and Mary are leaving for Australia early tomorrow morning.
Tom and Mary are sitting at the bar. Both look a little tipsy.
Does Tom really think he can convince Mary to buy his old car?
Tom asked Mary where she was going to be later in the evening.
I ought to study tonight, but I\'m tired so I\'m going to bed.
